text.0: even as a king hath soma red and tawny bull been pressed the wondrous one hath bellowed to the kine.
text.1: while purified he passes through the filtering fleece to seat him hawklike on the place that drops with oil.
text.2: to glory goest thou sage with disposing skill like a groomed steed thou rusbest forward to the prize.
text.3: o soma be thou gracious driving off distress thou goest clothed in butter to a robe of state.
text.4: parjanya is the father of the mighty bird on mountains in earths centre hath he made his home.
text.5: the waters too have flowed the sisters to the kine he meets the pressingstones at the beloved rite.
text.6: thou givest pleasure as a wife delights her lord listen o child of pajri for to thee i speak.
text.7: amid the holy songs go on that we may live in time of trouble soma watch thou free from blame.
text.8: as to the men of old thou camest indu unharmed to strengthen winning hundreds thousands.
text.9: so now for new felicity flow onward the waters follow as thy law ordaineth.
